definition: to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

sentences.english: Happiness and the absurd are two sons of the same earth.
sentences.chinese: 幸福与荒谬是同一块土地的双生子。

sentences.english: Neither the twins nor James knows how to spell the word.
sentences.chinese: 对双生子和詹姆斯都不知道这个词的拼法。

sentences.english: Although you are identical twins, what are your differences?
sentences.chinese: 身为同卵双生儿，你们有什么差别？

sentences.english: Your two breasts are like two fawns, Twins of a gazelle .
sentences.chinese: 3你的两乳好像一对小羚羊，就是母羚羊双生的。

sentences.english: Identical twins, which are relatively common in man and many animals, are genetic clones.
sentences.chinese: 在人类和很多动物中，同卵双生都是相对普遍的现象。

sentences.english: Geminiviruses are a group of single-stranded circular DNA viruses with twinned particles occurring worldwide.
sentences.chinese: 双生病毒是一类具有孪生颗粒的单链环状DNA病毒。

sentences.english: The twins were almost identical in looks.
sentences.chinese: 这对双生子的容貌几乎完全相同。

sentences.english: The essence of the union of a twin flame can never turly be replaced with another mate.
sentences.chinese: 双生子结合的本质，永远无法以另一个伴侣所替换。

sentences.english: Their faces were different, but they were dressed like twins.
sentences.chinese: 两个人面孔不同，但是穿得象一对双生儿似的。

sentences.english: Metal cleaning performance of geminate sulphonate surfactant was studied.
sentences.chinese: 研究了双生磺酸盐表面活性剂的金属清洗性能。

sentences.english: Mcteague exhibited his hard, calloused palms .
sentences.chinese: 麦克梯格摊开那双生满老茧坚硬的手掌。

sentences.english: The twins are so much alike that we can hardly tell them apart.
sentences.chinese: 这对双生子长得非常相像，我们几乎辩认不出他们。

sentences.english: Thy two breasts are like two young roes that are twins.
sentences.chinese: 你的两乳好像一对小鹿，就是母鹿双生的。

sentences.english: Non-identical twins are the result of two fertilised eggs implanting in the uterus at the same time.
sentences.chinese: 非同卵双生子是两个受精卵同时在子宫内着床的结果。

sentences.english: And if identical twins are fully human, wouldn't cloned people be as well?
sentences.chinese: 要是同卵双生是完整的人，那么，克隆人不也是吗？

definition: fire and ice/combination of sharply contrasting or incompatible elements
to communicate with the spirits/psychic/(ears) sensitive/(information) accurate

four divinities/four divine emperors/four mythical creatures symbolic of prosperity and longevity, namely the phoenix 鳳|凤[feng4], turtle 龜|龟[gui1], dragon 龍|龙[long2] and Chinese unicorn 麒麟[qi2 lin2]/also 四象[si4 xiang4], the four division of the sky
Asura, malevolent spirits in Indian mythology
rhinoceros horn, reputed to confer telepathic powers/fig. mutual sensitivity/tacit exchange of romantic feelings/a meeting of minds
